intro: Sida hederifolia, commonly known as common sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes. Sida hederifolia is known for its adaptability to various soil types and is often found in disturbed areas.
